document_data.name: Wrint Sprigley
document_data.mainbody:
'''Wrint Sprigley''' was a reporter employed by [[Baldur's Mouth]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''The Blushing Mermaid is an adrift shipwreck in more ways than one...''|Wrint Sprigley}}
document_data.Description: Wrint was a charcoal-skinned [[deep gnome]] who wore tunics and hats of quality make.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Wrint Sprigley penned ''The Baldur's Mouth Tavern Review'' column in the ''Baldur's Mouth Gazette''. During the [[Absolute crisis]], his quill targeted the [[Blushing Mermaid]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of Baldur's Gate. Wrint wandered the street near the tavern, mumbling the lines for the review. He criticized the establishment for its lack of direction and claimed that the Blushing Mermaid's atmosphere was ruined by street wanderers.
